Associating Configuration Files with Projects

Projects, by default, are not associated with a project configuration file.

To associate a project configuration file with a project:

  1. Select the project you want to associate with a configuration file.

  2. Select File | Properties. The Properties dialog box appears with the Project tab active.

  3. In the Configuration File field, enter the location and name of the configuration file to be associated with the project. To create a new configuration file, click the Browse button. The Select Configuration File dialog box appears with the name of the default project configuration file in the File Name field. To change the name and location of the configuration file, enter a new name and browse to select a directory, then click OK.

  4. On the Properties dialog box, click OK.

Continue to the next procedure, specifying an access control database for your project database or project.
